result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan J. Matthew

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan J. Matthew in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 16CM-174, 16CM-71, 15CM-499, 15CM-434, 16CM-83,  and 15CM-500.

3:12 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea today.

There is an agreement.

15CM-434:
Defendant is pleading to Count 1. 

15CM-499:
Defendant is pleading to Count 1.

16CM-71:
Defendant is pleading to Count 1.
Counts 2-3 Dismissed and Readin 

15CM-500: Dismissed and Read In
16CM-83: Dismissed and Read In
16CM-174: Dismissed and Read In

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM-434: Count 1: NO CONTEST
15CM-499: Count 1: NO CONTEST
16CM-71: Count 1: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
State has complied with victim notification statutes.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CM-434: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CM-499: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
16CM-71: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
16CM-71: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
16CM-71: Count 3: Dismissed and Read In
15CM-500: Dismissed and Read In
16CM-83: Dismissed and Read In
16CM-174: Dismissed and Read In


Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CM-434:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 90 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for employment and any counseling Defendant may be involved in. First half must be in jail. Second half may be on electronic monitor if approved by jail and risk assessment tool.
1 day jail credit
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Submit DNA Sample
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Obtain and maintain full time employment to the capacity Defendant is able to considering the treatment program
Engage with other counseling and assessments as recommended by the agent
No contact with the Verizon Store involved in this incident
Write letters of apology to the employees and officers that were present and EMT people that were present
Maintain absolute sobriety
Continue with AODA aftercare program Defendant is currently engaged in

15CM-499:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 90 days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for employment and any counseling Defendant may be involved in. First half must be in jail. Second half may be on electronic monitor if approved by jail and risk assessment tool.
1 day jail credit
Concurrent to 15CM-434
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to 15CM-434
Conditions:
Comply with conditions set forth in 15CM-434
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

16CM-71:
Jail sentence for 180 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for employment and any counseling Defendant may be involved in. First half must be in jail. Second half may be on electronic monitor if approved by jail and risk assessment tool.
1 day jail credit
Concurrent to 15CM-434 and 15CM-499
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to 15CM-434 and 15CM-499
Comply with conditions set forth in 15CM-434 and 15CM-499
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Any bond posted  in any of the files shall be applied to fine/costs/surcharges. 
Court will allow early discharge from probation if Defendant satisifies and completes probation and the agent recommends.

20 days in which to appeal the cases.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 26, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Ryan J. Matthew in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CM434, 15CM499 and 15CM500.

10:28 a.m.  Court calls case
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Atty Cousins indicates that new charges have been filed and would request a new  ptc date.
Atty Drengler would agree with new court date.

BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond continued on all cases  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ryan J. Matthew
Current: 1924 Prairie Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 01-26-2016)
Prior: 1924 Prairie Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States
Portage County Community Justice Program/Court Referral Form - filed in 15CM434

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
Cash previously posted on 15CM499. 
Condition amended:  Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center as able.
Conditions added: 
Defendant not to be on the premises of Verizon Store and no contact with any of the employees.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold.  
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.

Defendant Ryan J. Matthew appeared by video.  Defendant Ryan J. Matthew in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CM499, 15CM500, 15CM434

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY pleas entered to all cases/counts.

Atty Molepske notes 15CM434 is set for 1/11/16.  
Court will proceed with 15CM434.

15CM434 cash alternative was posted. 
Atty Molepske requests a $1,000 cash bond to cover all 3 files. 
Atty Drengler makes arguments for a signature bond and a day report increase. 

Clerk notes there is $1,000 cash posted in 15CM499 and 15CM500 no cash posted. 
Atty Molepske requests conditions be the same for all files.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.
